DataElement.preferredName: Thoracic Surgery Talc Pleurodesis Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not talc pleurodesis was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Thoracic Surgical Procedure Talc Pleurodesis Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any surgery performed inside the thoracic cavity._Finely-powdered native hydrous magnesium silicate.  When administered into the pleural space, talc initiates an inflammatory reaction, resulting in adhesion of the visceral pleura to the parietal pleura and fibrosis, thereby effectively closing the pleural space and preventing further accumulation of fluid. This agent exhibits no intrinsic antineoplastic activity. (NCI04)_A therapeutic surgical procedure in which the pleural space is surgically eliminated by the adherence of the visceral and parietal pleurae._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Surgery performed on the thoracic organs, most commonly the lungs and the heart.

Concepts.definition: Any surgery performed inside the thoracic cavity.

Property.preferredDefinition: Finely-powdered native hydrous magnesium silicate.  When administered into the pleural space, talc initiates an inflammatory reaction, resulting in adhesion of the visceral pleura to the parietal pleura and fibrosis, thereby effectively closing the pleural space and preventing further accumulation of fluid. This agent exhibits no intrinsic antineoplastic activity. (NCI04):A therapeutic surgical procedure in which the pleural space is surgically eliminated by the adherence of the visceral and parietal pleurae.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: Finely-powdered native hydrous magnesium silicate.  When administered into the pleural space, talc initiates an inflammatory reaction, resulting in adhesion of the visceral pleura to the parietal pleura and fibrosis, thereby effectively closing the pleural space and preventing further accumulation of fluid. This agent exhibits no intrinsic antineoplastic activity. (NCI04)
A therapeutic surgical procedure in which the pleural space is surgically eliminated by the adherence of the visceral and parietal pleurae.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for HCMI: Mesothelioma Curation Request 2.25.2021 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.
